sentence.Network_en: Twenty people were injured by falling masonry.
sentence.Network_cn: 有20人被倒塌的石墙砸伤。

sentence.Network_en: She was injured by falling masonry.
sentence.Network_cn: 她被倒塌的石墙砸伤了。

sentence.Network_en: The fall of masonry crushed the old man in the old house.
sentence.Network_cn: 炉墙倒坍将那老人压倒在旧房屋里.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French maçonerie, from maçon (see mason)

entry.def: Masonry is bricks or pieces of stone which have been stuck together with cement as part of a wall or building.

means.word_mean: 1. structure built of stone or brick by a mason
